meta.focus: Review of Kanji, Vocabulary, and Grammar from Lessons 35–36.

sections.title: Part 1: Conversation Check
sections.instructions: Read each conversation and select the best answer.

items.title: Conversation 1
items.context: A homeowner calls a contractor about a water leak.

lines.jp: すみません。家の 水が 止まりません。業者に 来て もらえますか。
はい。この 地区の 住民の 方ですか。
はい。主人も こまって います。早く 止めて ください。
分かりました。すぐ 行きます。水を 止める ことが できます。

items.question: What problem did the homeowner have, and what did the contractor promise?
choices: The bus service was cancelled; the contractor would fix the road.
The water would not stop; the contractor said they could stop it.
The contractor did dishonest work; the owner called the police.
The car wash was broken; the contractor said they would repair it.
items.answer: The water would not stop; the contractor said they could stop it.
items.explanation: A says 家の水が止まりません (the water won't stop) and B replies 水を止めることができます (we can stop the water).

items.title: Conversation 2
items.context: Two people talk about a bus service and their bad luck.

lines.jp: このバスの便は 不便ですね。一時間に 一本だけです。
ほんとうに 不運ですね。雨で 中止に なった 日も ありました。
主に 朝と 夕方だけ 動いて います。
不便な 地区ですね。業者に たのんで、もっと 便を ふやして もらいたいです。

items.question: What was inconvenient about the bus service?
choices: The bus only runs once an hour and was cancelled on rainy days.
The bus driver was a dishonest contractor.
The bus stop was inside a private house.
The bus mainly carried industrial products.
items.answer: The bus only runs once an hour and was cancelled on rainy days.
items.explanation: A says 一時間に一本だけ (only one bus per hour) and B mentions 雨で中止になった日もありました (there were also days it was cancelled due to rain).

sections.title: Part 2: Vocabulary
sections.instructions: Select the correct reading or meaning for each word.

items.explanation: 不味い (まずい / mazui) means bad-tasting or unpleasant. The 不 prefix negates 味 (flavor).

choices: ぎょうしゃ — contractor / business operator
items.answer: ぎょうしゃ — contractor / business operator
items.explanation: 業者 is read ぎょうしゃ (gyousha) and means contractor or business operator. 業 (N4.36) + 者 (N4.15).
産業 is read さんぎょう (sangyou) and means industry. 産 (produce/birth, N4.36) + 業 (business, N4.36).

choices: てあらう — to wash by hand
しゅせん — hand washing ritual
items.explanation: 手洗い is read てあらい (tearai) and means handwashing or restroom. 手 (hand, N5) + 洗 (wash, N4.35).
主に is read おもに (omoni) and means mainly or primarily. The kun reading おも of 主 is used adverbially.

sections.title: Part 3: Kanji Readings
sections.instructions: Select the correct reading for the [bracketed] kanji or word.

items.q: この 場所は [不]便です。
items.explanation: 不 is read ふ (fu) in the word 不便 (fuben, inconvenient). It is a negative prefix with on-reading ふ or ぶ.
業 is read ぎょう (gyou) in 業者 (gyousha, contractor). The on-reading ぎょう is used in most compound words.

items.q: この 地区の [産]業は 有名です。
items.explanation: 産 is read さん (san) in 産業 (sangyou, industry). The on-reading さん is used in compounds like 産業 and 産物.
洗 in 洗います is the masu-stem あらい of あらう (arau, to wash). The kun-reading is あらう.

sections.title: Part 4: Fill in the Blank
sections.instructions: Choose the word that best completes each sentence.

items.q: 雨で 電車が ______ に なりました。
items.explanation: 中止 (chuushi, cancellation) fits: the train service was cancelled due to rain. 中止になる means 'to be called off'.

items.q: この 国の ______ は 国の ほうりつを まもります。
items.explanation: 国民 (kokumin, citizens/nationals) fits: the citizens of this country follow the nation's laws. 国民 = 国 (country, N5) + 民 (people, N4.35).

items.q: 週まつに ______ を して、きれいに なりました。
items.explanation: 洗車 (sensha, car wash) fits: we did a car wash on the weekend and it became clean. 洗車 = 洗 (wash, N4.35) + 車 (car, N5).

items.q: この 地区の ______ は 車と 電気の 物です。
items.explanation: 産物 (sanbutsu, products/output) fits: the products of this district are cars and electronics. 産物 = 産 (produce, N4.36) + 物 (thing, N4.5).

sections.title: Part 5: Translation
sections.instructions: Choose the correct English translation for each Japanese sentence.

items.q: 主人は 主に 洗車を して から、仕事に 行きます。
choices: The owner mainly washes the car before going to work.
The master mainly stops the car before going to the factory.
The husband mainly does laundry, then commutes to the industry.
The owner mainly uses the restroom before stopping work.
items.answer: The owner mainly washes the car before going to work.
items.explanation: 主人 (shujin) = owner/husband; 主に (omoni) = mainly; 洗車 (sensha) = car wash; てから = before/after doing; 仕事に行く = go to work.

items.q: 不便な 地区の 業者は 不運でした。
choices: The contractor in the inconvenient district had bad luck.
The inconvenient citizen was an unlucky business operator.
The dishonest contractor in the district was unfortunate.
The inconvenient industry produced bad products.
items.answer: The contractor in the inconvenient district had bad luck.
items.explanation: 不便な (fuben na) = inconvenient; 地区 (chiku) = district; 業者 (gyousha) = contractor; 不運 (fuun) = bad luck.

items.q: 国民が 産業を 止める ことは できません。
choices: Citizens will not wash industrial products.
The contractor cannot stop the citizens' business.
items.explanation: 国民 (kokumin) = citizens; 産業 (sangyou) = industry; 止める (tomeru) = to stop (transitive); ことはできません = cannot do.
